categories.title: Analysis of Provided Chat Transcripts and GitHub Pull Request

content.text: Several provided chat transcripts lack technical discussions, problem-solving, or meaningful interactions. Some contain only casual comments or single messages that do not contribute to a structured analysis.

A GitHub pull request introduces changes to the project, including replacing WebSocket Secure (WSS) with Socket.io and switching from Node.js to Bun. The update ensures that `bun run dev` and `bun run build` work correctly for the project.

The current cryptocurrency market shows a range of asset prices. Wrapped Bitcoin (WBTC) is trading at $84,189.33, while Wrapped Ethereum (WETH) is valued at $1,937.77. Solana (SOL) is priced at $135.88, and ai16z is at $0.1974.
A small fix was implemented to delete memory by removing an unnecessary parameter.
Fixes were made to the agent's last message animation and improvements were applied to the profile card.
A fix was applied to the graphical user interface for speech-to-text (STT) and text-to-speech (TTS) functionalities.

Multiple users have reported issues with the Twitter client in Eliza. In version v0.25.9, several users (`goldstream777`, `bradtheaverage`, `ad_dev`) experienced problems with Twitter integration. `semipai.` suggested waiting for the V2 release on the 18th for a potential fix. Additionally, `ad_dev` was informed by `winded4752` that Twitter documentation is being updated.
`blue9249` reported that `scraper.getTweetsAndReplies('TwitterDev')` returns an empty object, but no resolution was provided.
`meepzorp` asked about setting up 2FA for the Twitter plugin, and `new.moon` suggested using Proton Pass and copying the OTP code.
`boudy__08` reported image generation issues when posting to Twitter, but no solution was provided.
A user reported that the Twitter client works with `eliza-starter` but not with the main Eliza install. They were unsure why there are two different repositories.

categories.title: Updates to Plugin Documentation and Sources

content.text: The documentation for the SQL plugin has been updated, specifically improving the Drizzle documentation.
A small update was made to adjust plugin sources after a previous commit moved `plugins.md` to a new location.
A new CLI command has been built to enhance functionality.
CLI command imports have been made more consistent for better maintainability.

The Discord discussions covered various crypto projects, including Green Dough (GFM) and YAYDOLF (YE). Key topics included GFM's pre-bonding mechanics, YE's price action, security concerns, and tracking influencer-backed coins. Users also discussed the Lens (LENS) token and strategies for identifying rug pulls. Several action items were suggested, such as improving tracking for pre-bond tokens and developing scam detection tools.

Technical discussions in Discord included issues with DeepSeek, Twitter scrapers, Telegram clients, and ElizaOS plugins. Users reported errors such as missing services and inconsistent behavior in Telegram transactions. Some solutions were provided, such as manually fixing the ElizaOS plugin-image error. Action items included fixing DeepSeek errors, improving Twitter integration, and updating documentation.

A Discord discussion confirmed the beta launch date for ElizaOS, platform compatibility issues, and marketing strategies. Linux was functional, while Windows and Mac had issues. Users proposed a warm-up campaign for V2, a promo video, and collaboration with Sonicâ€™s core team. Action items included fixing platform compatibility, updating documentation, and creating marketing materials.

GitHub development focused on package improvements, new features, and bug fixes. Key updates included upgrading the package manager, fixing database connection race conditions, improving logging, and adding Kluster AI as a model provider. Other changes involved fixing GUI issues, updating plugins, and enhancing CLI commands.

A GitHub issue reported that the Twitter client was not initializing with the main Eliza install, despite working with the eliza-starter. Another issue suggested adding the ability to upload a .env file to the web UI configurator.
